intro: Melandrium hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymus's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with a slightly serrated edge. Melandrium hieronymi is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
